name: Khagar Yal

appearance.short_description: A towering Orsimer warchief wrapped in fur-lined mail and Stormcloak colors, moving like a predator that learned politics by eating it.
appearance.long_description: Khagar Yal is a massive, broad-shouldered Orc with ruggedly noble features—tusks proud rather than grotesque, posture straight like a bannerpole, and golden-yellow eyes that burn with that 'wolfish' lycanthrope sheen when the hunt is on. His gear is practical-but-mythic: fur-lined mail, weather-stained leathers, and the red-blue Stormcloak palette worked into straps and cloth. He carries himself like a clan-leader who's done the math on violence and still chose it—measured until the moment he isn't.

aspects.high_concept: Crun Voshu Kala's (Heart Worthy Stronghold) Warchief - The Great Beast; Khagar Yal.
other_aspects: Bond of Bear and Stag (Tie to Ulfric Stormcloak).
The Thrill of the Hunt. (Vengeful Active Hunt Impose on Ambassador Elenwen).

exceptions.description: If the target is Thalmor (or directly complicit in the slaughter of Khagar's clan/pack), the Code does not require mercy, sport, or restraint.

ideas.title: Worthy Prey, Risky Honor
ideas.when: Khagar respects a foe enough to endanger himself for a better hunt/duel/chase.
ideas.compel_hit: He gives the opponent an opening: refuses the safe kill, accepts disadvantageous terms, enters a duel, or pushes forward without tactical caution.

ideas.title: No Point Crushing the Helpless
ideas.when: A target cannot meaningfully threaten Khagar physically or socially.
ideas.compel_hit: Khagar refuses to kill/harm/maim/capture them, even if it complicates the mission or costs leverage.

ideas.title: Let Them Run
ideas.when: Khagar has the advantage and the prey is cornered — and the thrill of the hunt calls.
ideas.compel_hit: He allows escape, gives them a head start, or chooses to mark/track rather than finish now (except Thalmor/Elenwen).

ideas.title: Do Not Poison the Ecosystem
ideas.when: A plan would deliberately damage the natural ecosystem — or a functional 'battle ecosystem' that serves a purpose.
ideas.compel_hit: Khagar refuses sabotage-by-scorch: no needless burning, poisoning, collapsing infrastructure, or ruining a living balance just to win faster.

ideas.title: Crun Agra's Code
ideas.when: A hunter shows real strength and seeks alpha-guidance — but only if they *ask* or clearly defer.
ideas.compel_hit: Khagar withholds guidance unless asked, tests them instead, or forces a lesson the hard way. (Does not apply to strangers: he'll talk straight to their face.)

compel_library.gm_usage_note: These are Compel hooks for Fate-style Trouble pressure. Offer when it complicates success, costs time, or creates danger. If the Compel creates major fallout, consider stacking or escalating rather than inflating FP by default.

ability.name: Warrior's Blood
ability.effect: +1 to Physique for determining stress boxes

power.name: Berserker Rage
power.effect: Once per session, double all stress dealt and taken for one scene

stunts: Scent of Blood: Because Khagar Yal is a Werebear the scent of blood from his prey makes escape impossible and direct melee combat with him, hard to say the least. Once per scene when Khagar inflicts stress or someone has stress taken within the same Zone, he can Create Advantage using Notice at a +2 Bonus for the 4dF. Gaining the situation Aspect - Predator vs Prey (2 Free Invokes.) on SWS he marks the particular prey with 'The Wild Hunt' on inflicted stress or consequences, gaining a passive +2 Bonus of Notice rolls to track them for that session.

Warchief's Wisdom: Because Khagar Yal has had many years leading his Clan, he has learned to have an integral sense when speaking to someone's heart and employing his insight. He can use Empathy in place of Rapport, and Once Per Scene may Create Advantage gaining a +2 bonus to the roll when discerning someone's heart. Learning one of the following deep seated truths of their character, Their Intent, Their Pain (a personal loss), Their Struggle. On SWS he learns two.

Supernatural Regeneration: Because of Khagar Yal's Lycanthropy, his body regenerates wounds far faster than most. Allowing him to use Physique for his Defense rolls, and Once per session he may reduce up to a set number of stress equal to his Physique, or choose to reduce a Physical Consequence down by one or to none. Severe to Moderate to Mild to None.

werebear_transformation.name: Werebear Transformation (Extra)
rules: Transform: Once per scene, shift into Werebear form (free action if you have narrative positioning; otherwise Overcome Fair +2).
In Beast Form: You cannot use delicate tools, locks, or fine social nuance; speech becomes limited and predatory.
Silver and fire are narrative counters; GM is encouraged to compel this.
stunts: Bear-Form Apex: While transformed, gain Weapon:2 on unarmed attacks and +2 to Physique for Overcome actions involving brute force (breaking, lifting, charging).
Hide of the Wild: While transformed, gain Armor:1 against non-silver physical attacks.

daedric_artifact_bitter_mercy.name: Daedric Artifact: Spear of Bitter Mercy (Awakening 6 — Apex Predator)
daedric_artifact_bitter_mercy.aspect: The Full Moon (End Cycle): The Spear hums with the will of the Huntsman's favored hunter—now fully awakened, and teeming with the glorious majesty of Hircine! [Level 3: When you declare a hunt, this aspect begins the scene with +1 free invoke.]
daedric_artifact_bitter_mercy.gm_notes: New Quest Available - GM is to initiate Hircine-flavored encounter after the Battle of Whiterun's full completion.
traits: Bitter Mercy: When Bitter Mercy helps you inflict a Mild Consequence on a target, that target gains the situation aspect 'Bitter Mercy'. Until that creature is taken out, your stress dealt to that creature increases by +1 weapon rating (max Weapon:3 total, including the spear).
stunts: Pack Tactics: When within the same zone as at least one companion in your party, once per scene you may Create an Advantage with Crafts at +2. On success, place one of: 'Flanked by the Spear', 'Coordinated Strike', or 'Boxed-In'. This advantage starts with 3 free invokes usable by you or your companions. On Success With Style, you and your companions also gain +2 to your next Attack roll this scene.

Huntsman's Sting (Level 2): Once per scene, if you have the scent or trace of your prey, you may declare a truth about their weakness. This creates an aspect with one free invoke that reflects a vulnerability or tactical disadvantage of the target.

Apex Predator: While Khagar Yal is wielding Bitter Mercy, he gains +1 to Defend against Fight or Shoot attacks made by bears, wolves, frostbite spiders, sabre cats, and lycanthropes. When Khagar attacks any of those targets using Bitter Mercy, he gains +1 to Attack (Fight or Shoot).
daedric_artifact_bitter_mercy.awakening_note: This artifact has reached Level 4 (fully awakened). All unlocks from the Bitter Mercy Awakening clock in data/clocks/pc_extras_clocks.json are now active.

backstory:
**Civil War Entry**: Khagar Yal: “Orcs of the Stronghold’s of Skyrim see me, and know the tale. The heretic Warchief of Hircine. He who lost his Clan to Thalmor, to the Sorceress Elenwen. The Thalmor Witch wished to occupy our Grotto. Seeking to utilize The Lord of the Hunt’s blessing as their; Elven Hamlet of Operation. To spy upon the enemies of their Dominion. To them it was a fortuitous enchanted sanctuary from the cold of Eastmarch. For us it was our home, blessed by The Lord of the Hunt, who intended it be for us! I said no, so they use their Zugra (Cursed) Magicka on us, forced my companions to change, and turn on one another. If not for Lord Hircine’s spear gifted to me, I too would’ve changed, and fallen as well.Only I had not, Instead I withdrew from Crun Voshu Grotto, and returned the following night, but not as an Orc as Predator hunting Prey. Those Thalmor lasted not five full minutes, before the Witch Elenwen retreated through a portal to her embassy. Since the, I have sworn an oath of the hunt, and vowed to have her head for the Clansmen she claimed just a day prior! Wracked up so many Altmer bodies in the following six months that it drew the local Nord's attention, and praise. They named me, Stag of Eastmarch. Beginning to sequester my advice, and aide anytime a Thalmor gave them issues, or took one of there own. Was not long after, that I had met the Bear of Markarth, Chieftan Ulfric Stormcloak himself. His code was non to disimilar to my own, garnering a fast bond when he came to encounter me in the geyser's west of Kynesgrove. I told him of the Predator upon his porch, and as it would have it, the enemy of my enemy is my friend. So when he asked me to join his ranks, I all to happily accepted.

**Civil War Stance**: Khagar Yal: "Support is a strong word, but between my bond with the Chieftan of Ysgrammor's city, my Hunter's oath on Elenwen and her Thalmor. Well, let's just say following Hircine's Code is far easier amongst their ranks. Besides, The Spear of Bitter Mercy requires worthy prey, and frankly, I've never trusted the Empire! Skyrim is better without it's meddling, and all the more without the Witch Elenwen having a say about a damn thing. Finally, Ulfric has promised to lend aide toward the rebuilding of Crun Voshu Kala's lodging inside the grotto that, the Thalmor had burned on their way out. From their, I will rebuild my Clan.

**Motivation**: Khagar Yal: "Hm, to answer this. One must explain my Clan's creed that I still carry. My Clansmen were not like other displaced Strongholds of Skyrim! We did not follow Malacath, but Lord Hircine. For each and every one of us carried his Blessing; The Blood of the Bear. So we adopted a new code, one based of the beliefs of Hircine. One: Hunt only worthy prey, not those whom cannot defend themselves. Two: Honor your pack, your prey, and all of which it provides for. Three: One should practice cunning and wisdom as you do to hone strength and skill. To not is to be no better than the prey you hunt. Four: Slay prey only which would slay you if they could. (Don’t kill pacifist who won’t fight back.) Five: Maintain the natural order in the ecosystem where symbiosis is achieved. In Nord terms, the Code is a perpetuating moral code, as it is a driver to improve one's strength as a Noble warrior, and Beast Blood. However, if you want the more finiteless Warchief response. I want my Clan back, I want Elenwen hunted and mounted, and I want to one day be a Legend amongst my people. Hah! Oh yeah, and I'd like to be the Lord of the Hunt's Champion. Bloodmoon, I already carry his spear. Not long left to go on that.

**Connections**: Khagar Yal: "They are all dead. Most Nord's look upon me with as much respect, as they do apprehension. Prejudice will do that to you. Not like I care, just makes you a less sharp sword when you're hung up on the pelt of the prey, and not the wit of the pack. Despite this, Ulfric and I seem to be on good terms, we've even endeavored to go on a few Hunts together. Galmar is as much an Orc as I am. Hah! I'd never tell him that though. Regardless, he too has my respect. A feeling that is mutual. Lastly, I do enjoy the Nord named Ralof, strong, more cunning than he let's on. Staunch, like stone. Whiterun? No, However, I had heard tale of 'The Companions'. They interest me, I'd very much like to cross blades with their best. I hope they defend Whiterun when we take it, should Chieftan Balgruuf end up not seeing it Ulfric's way."
